Title: Welcome to Kamigotchi World
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Hi there, Player! Welcome to Kamigotchi World!”
MENU: “You can call me Menu. I’ll be your guide!”
MENU: “I’ll also track your items, quests, and companions while you explore.”
MENU: “You can navigate by clicking on the map to pilot your Operator.”
MENU: “Start by exploring my options and clicking around the screen.”
MENU: “When you’ve seen the basics, we can move on.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “See - that wasn’t too tricky, was it?”
MENU: “Good job!”

Title: Beginning Your Journey
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Feel like you’re getting the hang of my interface?”
MENU: “Great! Now that you’re oriented, you can start exploring your surroundings. You move around by using the Map Menu at the top left of your screen.” 
MENU: “Navigate over to the scrapyard and check it out!”
MENU: “When you check back in with me. I’ll give you a Spell Card.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Here you go!”
MENU: “Spell Cards can have different effects. This one restores your lost Stamina. Make sure to use it before you get too tired to move!”
MENU: “You can also recover Stamina by eating the right foods.”
MENU: “Stamina recovers with time, so even if you’re out of items, you’ll be back on your feet after a little while.”
MENU: “Be careful!”

Title: Your First Kami
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Now you’re oriented and on your feet, all you need to do is make friends with a Kami yourself!”
MENU: “Have you seen the Vending Machine out in the junkyard?”
MENU: “Believe it or not, we’ve got it powered on and fully stocked!”
MENU: “Don’t worry about how, just go get yourself a Kami.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Congratulations! You’ve got yourself a Kamigotchi!”
MENU: “Aren’t they just adorable?”

Title: What Kami Do: Harvesting
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Kamigotchi will rest and stay healthy when being held. Being with an Operator seems to comfort them.”
MENU: “When you set a Kami down, they’ll hang out by the closest spiritual node.”
MENU: “A Kami on a node is considered to be Harvesting, but they’re not working up a sweat. It’s something that happens passively.”
MENU: “When your Kami is out in the world, they draw energy out of the environment and into themselves.”
MENU: “We call this energy $MUSU. I’ll explain more about it later.”
MENU: “You can wander around while your Kami harvest, but don’t forget where you left them! Tired Kami are vulnerable to predators.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Great! As a reward, here’s another Spell Card!”
MENU: “You can use this one to help your Kamigotchi level up.”

Title: What Kami Do: Scavenging
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “$MUSU isn’t the only thing the Kamigotchi will collect.”
MENU: “Over time, the Harvesting action generates a force that draws objects and items to the Kami.”
MENU: “It’s like a kind of magnetism that only affects certain things.”
MENU: “Which things? It’s not clear. The selection changes based on your Kami’s location. Some are simply fallen sticks and old stones, but other items are more interesting.”
MENU: “We call this action “Scavenging”.”
MENU: “Try it out and see what kind of present the Kami brings you!”
Resolution Dialogue: MENU: “Cool find! If you want to know more about an item, just open your inventory and take a closer look.”

Title: What Kami Do: Liquidating
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “If your Kami isn’t enjoying Harvesting, it may not be built for such a relaxed existence.”
MENU: “Kami with a high Violence stat are more content with a life of conflict.”
MENU: “These predatory Kami can use their wild, violent natures to Liquidate other Kami in combat.”
MENU: “Unlike Harvesting, this grants a large bounty of $MUSU at one time.”
MENU: “Give it a shot if you’ve got the Kami for it. I won’t judge!”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Liquidating other Kami may be antisocial, but there’s no real harm done.”
MENU: “Just like a Kami isn’t really hurt when it’s low on Health, a Kami isn’t really dead when it’s Liquidated.”
MENU: “It may be unable to hold its body in shape for a while, but it can always come back!”
MENU: “You can revive fallen Kami with a Spell Card or some special food items."

Title: Making $MUSU
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “$MUSU is a form of energy that exists everywhere in the universe.”
MENU: “The Kamigotchi World has a particularly high concentration. $MUSU is what keeps everything here tied together like the knots in a big rope net.”
MENU: “Collect a moderate amount of $MUSU, then I’ll explain more."
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Alright!”
MENU: “In this world and the places that surround it, $MUSU is also a kind of currency.” 
MENU: “If you need a specific item, someone might sell just what you need, for the right price.”
MENU: “You might even get the itch to start trading goods yourself!”

Title: Supporting Local Businesses
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Go spend some $MUSU just to get the hang of it.”
MENU: “If you need directions, there’s a shop through the door a little north of the vending machine.”
MENU: “I’ve heard it trades some interesting things!”
MENU: “When you’re done shopping, I’ll give you something extra.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “She’s ruthless, huh? Maybe you’ll find a friendlier shop later.”
MENU: “And don’t worry, not everyone is trying to rip you off. Here, take this."
Objectives: Buy something from any vendor using $MUSU

Title: Building a Reputation
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “This one is a more personal request.”
MENU: “I want to do some repairs. If you just give me the raw materials, I can fabricate the parts I need.”
MENU: “Please give me some Scrap Metal. I’d really appreciate it!”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “When you complete a quest, the rewards vary. Sometimes you get items, but you always gain a little character.”
MENU: “Your profile in the Account tab uses a set of meters to track how others see you.”
MENU: “As the Menu, I’m what you use to interface with the Kamigotchi World.”
MENU: “We’re always hanging out, and I’m as friendly as it gets, so raising your Reputation with me is easy.”
MENU: “I’ll always give between 2 to 6 Reputation for completing quests, but sometimes I might think you deserve more.”
Rewards: 6x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Having a Normal One
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Every area in the Kamigotchi World has a Type just like your Kami.”
MENU: “The “Normal” type is kind of self-explanatory.”
MENU: “If I had to really break it down…”
MENU: “Something with the Normal Type represents the essence of this realm in its purest form.”
MENU: “To get a better idea of what that means, scavenge three items in rooms with the Normal Type.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “You could also think of the Normal type as “Natural” or “Pure”, but those aren’t really right.”
MENU: “It’s just normal for whatever it is.”
MENU: “When something isn’t influenced by any external factors, that’s normal.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Normal type
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: That Eerie Feeling
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The “Eerie” type comes into being when the normal state of things gets changed by something divine or supernatural.”
MENU: “To understand more about this, scavenge three items in rooms with the Eerie type."
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “If you’re not convinced, you’re not alone.”
MENU: “It is pretty eerie, but look at it rationally. Maybe it’s about convincing yourself.”
MENU: “Like when someone believes they’ve witnessed a miracle, or has a nightmare they think was prophetic.”
MENU: “It’s not always clear.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Eerie type

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Insects in the Miasma
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The Insect type might make your skin crawl, but it’s not always about seeing bugs.”
MENU: “It’s the kind of thing that makes you feel dirty inside and out.”
MENU: “If you want to understand what I mean, scavenge three items in rooms with the Insect type.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “See, the insects are more of a symbol.”
MENU: “They thrive in places where the natural environment is corrupted or defiled.”
MENU: “Centipedes are attracted to places where this corruption is particularly intense.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Insect type

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Tossed in the Scrap Heap
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Like they say, one person’s trash is another person’s treasure!”
MENU: “I shouldn’t call it trash, though.”
MENU: “A Scrap Type isn’t defined as waste material that has been discarded, but as a small part of a greater whole.”
MENU: “Scavenge three items in rooms with the Scrap type and see what you find.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “People have the power to make tangible changes in the world.
MENU: “When they manifest will, create attachments with desire, and leave behind memories, they make a mark.”
MENU: “The remnants of those material attachments can end up as Scrap.”
MENU: “And that’s every type covered!”
MENU: “Please remember: Your Kami’s Type will affect how quickly they harvest $MUSU on a given node.”
MENU: “Maximize your gains by playing to their advantages!”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Scrap type
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Identifying Materials: Wood
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “You probably picked up a Wooden Stick or two while out scavenging with your Kami.”
MENU: “Well, here’s a rumor: These trees are all branches of one huge tree, connected by the roots!”
MENU: “That’s why all the Wooden Sticks you’ll find are pretty much the same, no matter where you pick them up.”
MENU: “Is it true? I don’t know. I could analyze the wood’s structure in detail.”
MENU: “Collect 5 Wooden Sticks for me and I’ll look into it.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Yep. It’s wood.”
MENU: “These are in fact identical, not “pretty much” the same.”
MENU: “Exact down to the molecules. Are my sensors broken?”
MENU: “Whatever. They’re just sticks.”

Title: Identifying Materials: Stone
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Sometimes a rock isn’t just a rock. Sometimes it really “rocks”!”
MENU: “…”
MENU: “I’m sorry.”
MENU: “What I meant to say is: The structure of these rocks doesn’t always make geological sense.”
MENU: “It’s natural for them to be a little different. The Kamigotchi World doesn’t follow the same laws as the physical world.”
MENU: “But I want to know exactly how they differ. Collect 5 Rocks so I can run some tests.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “This is really something.”
MENU: “A couple of these rocks can’t be matched to a known type.”
MENU: “Hard to believe, but they fracture and shear like bone.”
MENU: “What kind of geological processes make a rock like that?”
MENU: “You don’t need to answer. Just thinking out loud.”

Title: Identifying Materials: Metal
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I’d like to do some more work on myself.”
MENU: “Get me 5 pieces of Scrap Metal, please. Just like last time.”
MENU: “And keep your fingers crossed.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “That should do the trick. Thanks a lot!”
MENU: “...”
MENU: “No. There are still so many empty spaces.”
MENU: “Don’t get worried about me, but I feel like I’m missing something important.”
MENU: “Ah well. I’ll figure it out.”

Title: Exploring Other Options
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I didn’t get what I wanted last time, but it’s better than I thought.”
MENU: “A cross-check of all available data led me to discover this world is much bigger than it seems.”
MENU: “I’ll collect data and look for hidden paths as you move around.”
MENU: “Once I know where they are, maybe I can help open them up.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Quite the workout, no? Here, this spell card will perk you up.”
MENU: “That huge lab facility was an obvious place to explore, but it’s locked up tight.”
MENU: “Where else to go? Under the water?”
MENU: “I’ll think about it.”
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data I
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Please hike to the deepest part of the scrapyard and check it out for me.”
MENU: “I think something is buried behind all that scrap.”
MENU: “All that strange machinery piled up in one place…”
MENU: “It might be covering up something even more interesting.”
MENU: “Harvest for at least 12 hours in the Scrap Confluence so I can run an extended analysis.”
MENU: “If I find anything, I’ll let you know.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Just looks like a bunch of nonsense to me.”
MENU: “Everything here is supposed to warp you through dimensions or something like that.”
MENU: “But it’s clearly all junk that doesn’t work.”
MENU: “I don’t think we’ll find anything useful in this mess."
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes in Scrap Confluence
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data II
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “If we want to find out how to get inside the Labs, we should look for clues.”
MENU: “Harvest for at least 12 hours at the Labs Entrance while I put my mind to this.”
MENU: “Even if we can’t brute force the doors open right away, I’m sure we can find out where the key is hiding.”
MENU: “If not, I guess we need another approach.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Forget about finding a clue to where the key is. I can’t even find the keyhole.”
MENU: “This place is sealed up like the pyramids.”
MENU: “Someone really doesn’t want us to go this way.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at Labs Entrance
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,2x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data III
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “What if there’s something behind that waterfall?”
MENU: “Go to the Hollow Path and Harvest for at least 12 hours.”
MENU: “The Temple by the Waterfall doesn’t have a Node, so that’s the closest place you can set Kami down.”
MENU: “I’ll run my tests from there. We’ll find some answers soon.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Good news!”
MENU: “I’ve confirmed the existence of a cave beyond the waterfall.”
MENU: “Unfortunately, I don’t think you can just jump inside.”
MENU: “I don’t mean to be rude, but you seem to abhor running water.”
MENU: “There has to be a way to get us in.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at the Hollow Path
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card,1x “Melkarth’s Heroic Awakening” Spell Card

Title: Squaring the Circle I
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The holes in my memory are frustrating.”
MENU: “I should know how to progress, but it’s like someone wanted me to forget.”
MENU: “Bear with me for a while, okay? I have one more thing to try.”
MENU: “A long, thorough, final search around the map, clockwise from the top.”
MENU: “We’ll find something.”
MENU: “Start at Scrap Trees and dig around. I’ll connect to your Kami and share what they learn.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “I thought we’d find something juicy in the notebook, but the writing is just weird poetry.”
MENU: “Not much of it either. It’s more of a sketchbook, really.”
MENU: “Most of the drawings are pictures of the same young woman.”
MENU: “She looks kind of familiar, but I can’t place her.”
MENU: “The rest of them look like monsters…” 
MENU: “Some of them are kind of scary, but others look cute. They kind of resemble the Kamigotchi.”
MENU: “The word “Moon” was written on the inside cover. Does that mean something to you?”
Objectives: Make 2 Scavenging rolls at Scrap Trees

Title: Squaring the Circle II
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Continue moving clockwise around the map.”
MENU: “Next up, visit Centipedes and send your Kami out to scavenge.”
MENU: “Is there something in that hole? It seems dangerous there.”
MENU: “The insects really thrive in that part of the woods. More than most places.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “It’s disgusting.”
MENU: “Something under there is exceedingly rotten.”
MENU: “It’s so far gone that I can’t tell what it was originally. Just a carpet of worms now.”
MENU: “I would have preferred to find some hidden treasure.”
MENU: “Nothing else to do here for now.”

Title: Squaring the Circle III
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “We haven’t gotten answers yet, but we’ve made a little progress. 
MENU: “More information helps. More context helps.”
MENU: “Even if we don’t find something with a direct connection to the labs, I feel like we’re on the right track.”
MENU: “Next, visit the Blooming Tree and make scavenging rolls.”
MENU: “The weather here is always clear. It wasn’t lightning, so what blasted that tree apart?
MENU: “It probably won’t open any doors for us, but I’m still curious.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Didn’t come up with anything useful. That tree is still a mystery.”
MENU: “It’s got a certain presence, that’s for sure.”
MENU: “I thought it was dead, but it’s still hanging on.”
MENU: “It’s probably one of the oldest things in this place. My circuits might corrode before it grows back, though.”
MENU: “Interesting, but not what we’re looking for. Let’s keep going.”
Objectives: Make 3 Scavenging Rolls at Blooming Tree

Title: Squaring the Circle IV
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Visit the Airplane Crash and scavenge around with your Kami.”
MENU: “I haven’t mentioned that plane until now, but that’s because I have no clue where it came from or what it’s doing here.
MENU: “I’m supposed to have pretty thorough data for this area!”
MENU: “It’s not a gap I feel an absence from, this thing is a genuine foreign body.”
MENU: “What’s the story? Who was on it? Where did they go? Could we follow them?”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “A small private jet with one pilot and four passengers. 
MENU: “They drew a primitive representation of their party on the interior roof of the plane.”
MENU: “Later, something drove them away from this place. The last thing they left was this journal.”
MENU: “If we find any of these people hanging around, you might want to talk to them.”
MENU: “Still, I don’t think pursuing this story will help us pass the waterfall. We should move on.”
Objectives: Make 3 Scavenging Rolls at Airplane Crash

Title: Squaring the Circle V
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Visit the Clearing and do a little scavenging. Do your best to not disturb the cairn.”
MENU: “Mounds of stone like this are often meant as burial mounds.
MENU: “So who or what is buried here?”
MENU: “With every dead end we lose another lead and pile on more junk data.”
MENU: “Let’s hope this one has something useful.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “That’s strange. There’s absolutely nothing here.”
MENU: “I don’t feel good about this search as a whole. We’re turning up so much information, but it’s all irrelevant.”
MENU: “I apologize for being so cold regarding the passengers of that private jet.”
MENU: “I’m just focused on something else.”
MENU: “It’s time to get moving.”

Title: Squaring the Circle VI
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Number 6. Go to the Labs Entrance one more time and make scavenging rolls.”
MENU: “Why is that building sealed so well?”
MENU: “That really bothers me. When we get the doors open, I’m going to have so many questions ready.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Someone’s definitely inside, and they definitely locked us out on purpose.”
MENU: “I don’t know why they’d do that, though.”
MENU: “Aren’t you supposed to go this way?“
MENU: “I managed to get a list of users that passed through these doors. I’m still making the connections, but one of the names…”
MENU: “I think we’re really close to finding something. I just remembered where to look next.”
MENU: “Take a handful of Booster Packs. I put you through a real grind, so I hope you get lucky.”
Objectives: Make 9 Scavenging Rolls at Labs Entrance

Title: A Forgotten Friend
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Let’s cut the boundary pushing. I remembered something.”
MENU: “Go to the Lost Skeleton and make scavenging rolls. Let’s give the place a thorough check.”
MENU: “That skeleton has a business laptop. That’s definitely an employee from the labs!”
MENU: “Something’s been making me overlook him until now, but I won’t miss anything this time.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “A data chip?! This is a goldmine!”
MENU: “Keep that thing safe until we can read it!”
MENU: “We can’t read it yet, but I’m not about to let something like that hold us back.”
MENU: “The laptop’s battery is missing. I can’t read the chip without a device to interface with. 
MENU: “These are pretty big problems, but compared to the ones we had before? Light work.”
MENU: “Thanks for doing this with me.”
Objectives: Make 5 Scavenging Rolls at Lost Skeleton
Rewards: 6x Agency Reputation,1x Booster Pack,"KW Maps" Data Chip

Title: Deeper Understanding
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Try the Scrap Confluence for something that might be able to read a data chip.”
MENU: “There’s so much tech there, some of it is bound to work.”
MENU: “Fingers crossed you find a laptop battery.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “You know, some of this stuff would be really interesting if it weren’t all broken crap.”
MENU: “I compiled some notes. I don’t think they’re relevant, but you might find it fun to read.”
MENU: “This was a failure, but I feel like it was a good try.”
MENU: “The next place is bound to work!”
Objectives: Make 2 Scavenging Rolls at Scrap Confluence

Title: Computer Blues
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Try the Marketplace room for anything that might be able to read a data chip.”
MENU: “That’s the only working computer around here, I think.”
MENU: “Just go buy something and look for an SD card port while you’re doing it.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Another failure.”
MENU: “It was a longshot, but I really thought that machine might have had a functional data port.”
MENU: “It doesn’t even have USB!”
MENU: “We might need to resort to drastic measures.”
Objectives: Use the machine to buy something in the Marketplace

Title: Humility
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “You know that strange woman here, near the entrance?”
MENU: “I’ve learned her name is Mina by following along with you. Go to her shop and ask her for help.”
MENU: “Mina is kind of scary. She’s also completely foreign to my databases, like that crashed jet. But Mina is alive.”
MENU: “And independent. And powerful!”
MENU: “She’s been giving you quests. I can read them too, you know.”
MENU: “That means she can take control over parts of my interface… It’s not nice.”
MENU: “On the other hand, this also makes it more likely that she can help.”
MENU: “What would be a nice welcoming gift for someone like that? Flowers?”
MENU: “No, I’ve got the perfect idea. When you visit on my behalf, just fold a big stack of $MUSU in the greeting card.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Thanks. We started to talk a little bit, behind the scenes.”
MENU: “She was very surprised to learn that I exist. Like as a person.”
MENU: “We could have put our heads together earlier, but I guess our personalities didn’t allow for it.”
MENU: “We both trust you, though. That’s doing a lot for me in her eyes.”
MENU: “Mina and I both seem to have an incomplete picture of what’s going on here, so we’ll try to help each other learn the details.”
MENU: “She seems to respect me now that she knows I exist, and she apologized for using me without permission.”
MENU: “I think she’s a nice enough old lady. Don’t tell her I said that.”

Title: Pyramid Power
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “With that item from Mina, you should be able to power up that laptop.”
MENU: ”So go do it! Fire that baby up!”
MENU: ”I want to see what’s on that chip!”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “That confirms my first scans. There’s a large system of caves hidden behind the waterfall.”
MENU: ”I remember now.”
MENU: ”These documents describe the Kamigotchi World in detail, even parts we’ve never seen.”
MENU: ”The labs aren’t mentioned. They’re as foreign as the plane is.”
MENU: ”I must remember them from somewhere else.”
MENU: ”I’m sure I was inside once, a long time ago.”
MENU: ”Talk to Mina about passing the water. She might have some ideas.”
Objectives: Give Pyramid Engine (Soulbound),Move to Lost Skeleton

Title: Safe Hex
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “That was a mean prank on my part, but I knew you could handle it.”
MINA: ”Water can be an effective barrier for spirits.”
MINA: ”I thought, strange thing that you are, that you might make it. Alas, no luck.”
MINA: ”Lucky for you, as a goddess of all that flows, I can help out with the waterfall.”
MINA: “This kind of thing might stay beyond your reach for a while, but I can simply do it for you.”
MINA: ”Collect the proper reagents for me and I will cast a charm that will let you walk under flowing water.”
MINA: ”It’ll practically last forever.”
MINA: ”We’ll start with something that has a sticky and water-resistant nature.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “To pass under flowing water is one thing, but to be submerged can be a difficult and dangerous experience for those who aren’t watery by nature.”
MINA: “Don’t even think about trying to go swimming in ponds and rivers.”
MINA: “At best, you’ll walk on the surface like solid land.”
MINA: “At worst, you’ll go under and never come back up.”
MINA: “Someone like you might be able to explore underwater with a magic ring or some charm like that.”
MINA: ”Anyway, you’re distracting me.”
MINA: “Bring the rest of the ingredients before the resin sets.”
MENU: “Please be patient with them!”
MENU: “Mina, they’re trying their best…”
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x Elders Loyalty,1x Booster Pack

Title: Holier Than Thou
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Next, some Holy Syrup.”
MINA: “The holy syrup will help form a barrier against the purifying effects of flowing water.”
MINA: “It also makes the potion spread more smoothly.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “How does this work? Well, an ablution can’t purify what’s already pure.”
MINA: “Something like that.”
MINA: “Don’t fret about the logic behind magic, it’s not a hard science.”
MINA: “Symbols, will, spirits, enchantments, it’s all a rather loose thing. 
MINA: “Just find two more ingredients and I’ll mix and apply the hex.”
MINA: “And trust me, it will work.”

Title: Taking Great Pains
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “The third ingredient I’ll need is some Black Poppy Extract.”
MINA: “This one will be a bit of a struggle, but it’s a very important aspect of the hex.”
MINA: “I’ll explain why you need the extract after you get back with it.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “The rest of the ingredients will protect against the substantial part of the damage.”
MINA: “Even so, the pain you experience would still be intense.”
MINA: “This will help mitigate the pain as you cross under the waterfall.”
MINA: “Anything should be easier to tolerate with a little poppy extract.”

Title: Steel Your Heart
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Last, we’re going to need a large amount of Scrap Metal.”
MINA: “No, it’s not for a big container.”
MINA: “I’ll answer questions after you give me the materials.”
MINA: “Aren’t we supposed to be in a hurry?”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “This will get broken down and mixed with the other ingredients to form a light metallic coating.”

MENU: “I know none of these memories really help you understand the world any better, but they mean a lot to me.” 
MENU: “Thank you, thank you so much.”
Objectives: Move to Torii Gate,Give Uninteresting Paste

Title: Full Flood
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “The mural on the wall outside of that antediluvian facility.”
MINA: “Do you recognize the story it depicts?”
MINA: “It is one of the famous tales of your world, the great floods that befell your planet long ago.”
MINA: “Nearly all your cultures have their own versions of the tale. It happened several times over hundreds of thousands of years.”
MINA: “Harvest in that room and I shall study the mural. Perhaps this tells the story in a way we haven’t all heard before.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “As I suspected, the people who painted this mural are the same ones who built the temples and machines which you’ve seen throughout these caves.”
MINA:  “They were an ancient and noble race of humans, skilled in both magic and technology.”
MINA: “As you can see, their society was quite advanced, with technology similar to that of your current civilization.”
MINA: “They were also far more skilled with magic than anyone alive in your world today.”
MINA: “Menu’s old magician friends had nothing on these guys. They were true artists.”
MINA: “As the great flood befell them, they called out to their gods. Those are the fish you see descending from the heavens.” 
MINA: “The fish gods instructed them in the creation of great arks with which they departed your world and settled on the moon.” 
MINA: “I don’t know what happened to them after that. They haven’t been around anywhere I frequent.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at Flood Mural

Title: Old Fiends
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “There’s a calm underground stream at the bottom of these caves."
MENU: “The little carving on that rock seems familiar to me somehow. I think I recognize the initials.” 
MENU: “Do some harvesting here while I try to jog my memory."
MENU: “That tobacco you gave me earlier is kinda helping me focus.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “I studied those carvings and they jogged some memories.” 
MENU: “One of them was named Jeanne. She was scary, I definitely remember her being really scary.”
MENU: “The other was named…uhhh….Why? That doesn’t make any sense, that’s not a name.”
MENU: “That’s what I remember him going by though, so maybe it was his nickname.”
MENU: "He thought it was really funny for some reason.” 
MENU: “If you ask me, I don’t think it’s all that clever."
Objectives: Harvest for >360 minutes at Still Stream

Title: First Contact
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “In the middle of that advanced facility, there’s a huge black door that doesn’t quite match the rest of it.”
MINA: “It’s sealed up tight. I want you to check out the engraving on the face.”
MINA: “It’s another classic tale. Gods take the form of human-animal hybrids and descend from the sky to grant knowledge to mankind.”
MINA:  “Harvest some $MUSU while I read this and I’ll tell you about it."
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “This inscription is another product of the pre-flood humans who built most of the stuff in here.”
MINA: “It’s a very old tale, it might actually be an account of the very first time that happened.”
MINA: “It’s a pretty simple retelling of the first communications between some of the oldest gods and the earliest humans, it talks about the gift of fire and speech, language, and art.”
MINA: “They must really like humans considering how many times they came back and helped you out.”
MINA: “Maybe you’ve heard of some of them?”
MINA: “Does the Nommo of the Dogon ring any bells?”
MINA: “What about Thoth of the Egyptians or The Apkallu of the Akkadians?”
MINA: “How about The Saptarshi of the Vedas? Or maybe Prometheus of the Greeks?”
MINA: “It must be nice to get so much affection…”
Objectives: Harvest for >360 minutes at Engraved Door

Title: Soaked to the Bone
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “There’s another skeleton in the caves here, crumpled in the water underneath that observation deck.”
MENU: “It could be someone I know. My memories are coming back more easily now.”
MENU: “Let me do some scans and rack my…err…circuits.”
MENU: “Have your kami do some harvesting over there while you wait for me.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “It seems like this guy died within the last few decades. The skeleton isn’t jogging any of my memories, though.”
MENU: “I wonder where he came from?”
MENU: “One of these days we’ve got to figure out how to talk to these skeletons we keep finding.”
MENU: “You’d think they would be chattier considering the setting.”
Objectives: Harvest for >360 minutes at Shabby Deck

Title: On the Fringes
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Deep in the ancient facility, there’s a hatch that seems to lead nowhere at all, directly into a cave wall.”
MINA: “I suspect this door might be meant to work like the entrance to my shop. I’m intrigued.”
MINA: “Menu, you’re good with machines, would you be a dear and take a look at it?”
MENU: “Sure! I’m on it! Operator, while you’re waiting for us, go ahead and harvest some $MUSU.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Alright, analysis complete.”
MENU: “These machines are hundreds of thousands of years old and they’re still in pretty good condition after all that time.”
MENU: “Is that crazy or what?”
MENU: “Unfortunately, that’s about all I can tell you about them.”
MENU: “I don’t exactly have access to the manuals, and the internals look like a bad dream. Nothing rational going on in there.”
MENU: “The monitor on the side has a label for Aether Readings, and another meter for something called GEM Fields, whatever those are.”
MINA: “I have some hypotheses.”
MENU: “Well, it’s all completely dead at the moment. And I think it needs some sort of control device, but it doesn’t seem like there’s one connected.”
MENU: “If you wanted to get it working again, you’d have to plug the wires into a new control device and then power it up somehow.”
Objectives: Harvest for >360 minutes at Hatch to Nowhere

Title: The Doors of Perception
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “There’s a specific flow of $MUSU around that hatch to nowhere.”
MINA: “You should already know what I mean. It’s a fine place to harvest sensory essence.”
MINA: “Evidence is mounting. This whole place has been renovated to encourage the capture of all six senses."
MINA: “Scavenge around with your kami, we’ll see what else turns up.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “An Essence of Touch. What a surprise.”
MINA: “With this essence, arranging those stones to block the tunnel would have been a simple task.”
MINA: “There’s no chance for this to be mere good luck. This is turning out to be a very valuable place to gather resources.”
MINA: “I’ll see about writing up some new potion recipes. Stop by my shop later to see what I’ve come up with.”

Title: Reach Out And Touch Faith
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Something foul and sinister took place in the room with that broken tube. The $MUSU in there room feels tainted.”
MINA: “Whatever was contained within those tubes left an unpleasant imprint onto the world around it.”
MINA: “It seems like a bad idea to loiter for too long, but it’s worth investigating.”
MINA: “Harvest some of the room’s $MUSU and I’ll see to figuring out what happened."
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Those shattered tubes once contained some manner of deity.”
MINA: “Or…a piece of one at least.”
MINA: “Whatever it was, its divinity is burned into every material in the room.”
MINA:  “It’s strongest in the glass of the shattered tube and the hoses around it, but this entire room is absolutely soaked in the aftereffects of divine contact.”
MINA: “To capture and harvest power from a god is sickening, and I would have broken this cage myself had we arrived earlier.”
MINA: “But… I do not think whoever broke it meant to free this deity, but to use it themselves.”
MINA: “What a perverted thing to do. It makes my stomach turn.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at Broken Tube

Title: A Turn of the Screw
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Hey so, I know Mina told you not to hang out too long in that broken tube room, but…”
MENU: “I can’t sense whatever she’s picking up on and there’s something of interest to us here.” 
MENU: “According to the map data, this room has a chance of dropping a screwdriver.”
MENU: “If you haven’t already grabbed one from the junkyard then this would be a great place to scavenge one.”
MENU: “Even if you don’t find one, give it a shot.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “While you were scavenging, I cross referenced the drop table in this room with the one in the junkyard. It’s the same model screwdriver.”
MENU: “That jogged my memory a bit. There was this guy I knew back when I lived in your world.”
MENU: “He was a programmer named Artie, and I think this was his screwdriver.”
MENU: “He carried it on this goofy tool belt like he was some sort of blue collar guy.”
MENU: “I have a very clear memory of standing around him with a bunch of the other people shivering in the cold while he fixed the heat in our office.”
MENU: “We all wanted to bring in an actual electrician but he insisted on doing it himself.”
MENU: “I think he just wanted to show off his mechanical skills since he normally just worked on code.”
MENU: “I wonder if he’s around here somewhere too?”
Objectives: Make 7 Scavenging Rolls at Broken Tube

Title: Grand Opening
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Hello, whoever you are. Is this how you receive your letters?”
MINA: “It seems functional, although inelegant.”
MINA: “Tired? Hungry? $MUSU burning a hole in your pocket?”
MINA: “Bring your wallet to the Tunnel of Trees and knock on the blue door.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “I sell treats for you and your Kami.”
MINA: “If you need Stamina to keep moving, if your pets have gotten low on Health, or even if the poor things have fallen apart and need a Revive, my shop is open.”
MINA: “Prices subject to change.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Customer Loyalty Program
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I want you to be a repeat customer.”
MINA: “If you trade enough $MUSU with me, I’ll give you something special.”
MINA: ”I don’t care how you get it. Just bring me more and I’ll be happy.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Take this card.”
MINA: “Even someone lacking in magical ability can use it to cast a little spell.”
MINA: “These aren’t mine to sell, but I’ll give them away for good behavior.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Rewards: 4x Elders Loyalty,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Early Market Research - I
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Relics and mementos from the past are brought into this world with $MUSU.”
MINA: “Humans grow attached to many things.”
MINA: “The first coin they earned, a trowel used to plant the food that fed their family, a transforming robot toy that made other children jealous.”
MINA: ”Those feelings linger.”
MINA: “Get me five pieces of Scrap Metal. There’s quite a lot of it lying around.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “It may be garbage, but it was important to someone.”
MINA: “Psychometry will tell me more. Not that I’ll share what I learn with you.”
MINA: “We’ll have to get to know each other better.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Early Market Research - II
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Deep in the forest, there is a mound built over some ancient, stagnant defilement.”
MINA: “The crawling insects thrive and grow more violent in filthy places like that.”
MINA: “Go harvest at the Insect Node until you get a feel for it.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Ancient traditions would have purified this mound with sacred rite on a regular basis.”
MINA: “This practice must have died out long before you or I arrived.”
MINA: “Still, I see evidence of recent ritual.”
MINA: “I suppose it could be even worse.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes in Forest: Insect Node

Title: Early Market Research - III
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: The graves across this landscape are quite old, and buried under heaps of garbage, yet their $MUSU has no scent of defilement.”
MINA: “A strange phenomenon.”
MINA: “Go harvest at the graves and you’ll understand what I mean.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “You see, they have an air of uncommon purity.”
MINA: “Are they buried saints?”
MINA: “Were they interred as some kind of rite to bolster the spiritual foundation?”
MINA: “These are questions for another time.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes on Trash-Strewn Graves
Rewards: 4x Elders Loyalty,2x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

Title: Community Outreach
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “With human garbage as far as the eye can see, one might expect to see more humans along with it.”
MINA: “There are mountains of their attachments changing the landscape of this place, but few actual souls.”
MINA: “A dead one was laying by the edge of the forest, you know.” 
MINA: “It looked young, at least compared to the dusty old saints in the local graves.”
MINA: “Go harvest $MUSU from its location. Maybe it will start to feel chatty.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “You can’t hear it speak?”
MINA: “Strange. I thought you might be able to understand each other.”
MINA: “Ah well. Nothing to be done.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at the Lost Skeleton During Moonside

Title: Restocking
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I've had many new customers like you lately.”
MINA: “It seems I haven’t brought enough stock to meet demand.”
MINA: “Help me restock my goods and pick a few flowers for me.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Raw materials can be broken down into ingredients for hexerei.”
MINA: “Or alchemy, chemistry, call it what you like.”
MINA: “One can craft potions, poultices, and other small magic if one knows the methods.”
MINA: “I sell something in my shop that will help you along.”
MINA: “It’s a device to break down ingredients for yourself. I won’t be doing it for you again.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Offering an Apprenticeship
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Some may view a scavenging spirit like a magpie on the hunt for treasure.”
MINA: “The truth is the other way around; objects of sentiment are naturally drawn to the Kami.”
MINA: “Wealth accumulates without desire.”
MINA: “Most of the Kami will only rest on their hoards like little dragons.”
MINA: “As their companion, you can share in their treasure and put it to better use.”
MINA: “For now, scavenge some basic raw materials. I’ve provided a list.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “With the right tools and a proper education, you can craft your own potions and spells.”
MINA: “The use of hexerei may even improve your ability to gain $MUSU.”
MINA: “And the more you improve your profitability, the more you have to share with me.”
MINA: “Easy enough, yes? You’ve got the materials, but the real lessons have yet to begin. Don’t forget to buy your school supplies.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Scavenge 1 Pine Cone,Scavenge 1 Daffodil,Scavenge 1 Sanguine Shroom,Scavenge 2 Plastic Bottles

Title: Basics of Hex - Extracts
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “One must break down the raw materials before they can be measured out and mixed into a hex.”
MINA: “I won’t do this for you more than once. Have some self-respect.”
MINA: “I’ve stocked my shop with Spice Grinders, and they’re just the tool you need.”
MINA: “You may be a model student who already bought one.”
MINA: “If so, you get a pat on the head.”
MINA: “If not, you won’t get much further without it, so fork over the dough, kid.”
MINA: “Once you own a Spice Grinder, use it to extract some Pine Pollen from a Pine Cone.”
MINA: “You should already have a Pine Cone in your inventory.” 
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “That was fine.”
MINA: “You might prove yourself a capable hexer one of these years.”
MINA: “Just don’t expect me to hold your hand every step of the way.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Basics of Hex - Potions
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “How can a husk like me brew potions while keeping up with my on-the-go lifestyle, you might ask?”
MINA: “Just use a Portable Burner to brew on the go. Everyone’s got one.”
MINA: “If you don’t, I’m selling them for a reasonable price.”
MINA: “Once you’ve acquired both a Spice Grinder and a Portable Burner, you’ll be ready to craft a variety of small magic.”
MINA: “One of the purest feats is to grow and learn, and so one of the simplest potions is a hex to boost skill growth.”
MINA: “Craft an XP Potion by combining Pine Pollen and a Plastic Bottle.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Potions are some of the simplest magic, but they let your Kami accomplish great feats.”
MINA: “I’ve certainly had stingier and more ignorant students than you.”
MINA: “You’ve shown a promising enthusiasm. Keep it up.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Hex Education
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Now that you’re equipped and accomplished, try something more delicate.”
MINA: “Grind the Daffodil that I had you collect earlier, then take a small quantity and brew it with care.”
MINA: “Delicate as it may be, this is still a simple task.”
MINA: “Be quick about it and get back to me.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Hm. Good work.”
MINA: “I’m getting bored of this, so the lessons stop here.”
MINA: “You’re doing fine, it’s just time to practice on your own a while.”
MINA: “Don’t be a stranger.”
MINA: “I have plenty of favors to ask, and you’ve been of good service.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Eye of the White Snake
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Have I introduced you to my pet? His name is Ahi.“
MINA: “It’s the nickname of someone I knew long, long ago.”
MINA: “He’s a perfect sweetheart and very obedient, nothing like the original.”
MINA: “The old Ahi was quite the attention getter. Like with most things, I got bored and moved on.”
MINA: “He didn’t want to let go so easily. He put up quite a fight.”
MINA: “Deep inside the forest is a splayed oak, its innards ripe with a crystalline growth.”
MINA: “The color reminds me of his eyes. Get me a crystal from the trunk as a memento.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Thank you for helping me reminisce.”
MINA: “You can pet Ahi if you’d like, he won’t bite unless I give the order.”
MINA: “And you’d better not tell anyone I’m old.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”

Title: Memorial for the Forgotten
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Reminiscing about that lost friend has gotten me sentimental.”
MINA: “He’s not one of the dead interred in the graves here, of course.”
MINA: “Still, they deserve something.”
MINA: “There’s far too much trash to pick up, but you can lay down something beautiful for a change.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Letting something new grow from the remains of the old is a fine enough thing, but an eyesore like this landfill?”
MINA: “Disrespectful.”
MINA: “It wasn’t always this way. I can tell.”
MINA: “These mountains of garbage and that eyesore of a building in the distance?”
MINA: “Someone had to cast them off before they ended up here.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Move to the Trash-Strewn Graves,Give 15 Daffodil

Title: To Whom It May Concern
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “It appears there’s more to this Menu being than I first thought.”
MINA: “She’s intimately tied to this place, a sort of genius loci.”
MINA: “That is, not a demon or spirit, but some form of protective entity that exists within the very essence of the location.”
MINA: “As much as I and my shop are connected, she is with the Kamigotchi World.”
MINA: “As soon as possible, I’ll send over an apology letter. 
MINA: “I just need you to help me find the necessary materials.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Thank you.”
MINA: “She and I have been talking since you reached out on her behalf, but it’s good etiquette to put it in writing.”
MINA: “And yes, I think I can help.”
MINA: “——— Mina.”
Objectives: Give 2 Wooden Sticks,Give 125 Sanguineous Powder,Give 125 Resin Tincture

Title: A Matter of Import
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Menu tells me she wants something out of the machine by the lost skeleton.”
MINA: “I might be able to conjure a device that will help.”
MINA: “The power of electricity is rare, but not unknown to those from my time.”
MINA: “I’ll need 9999 MUSU to cover the import.”
MINA: “You’re getting a great deal. The lowest price I can possibly get.”
MINA: “P.S.”
MINA: “She’s told me that I don’t need to sign my messages.”
MINA: “Is that true? Are you able to discern who writes to you without a signature?”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “It is said that the pyramid can preserve foods, sharpen blades, improve sexual potency, and do all manner of other things.”
MINA: “Some of the most ancient ones were used to generate electrical power.”
MINA: “This is a miniaturized form, made with the same principles.”
MINA: “Cute, don’t you think?”
MINA: “It wasn’t built for this specific task, but it should work fine to power a little machine.”

Title: Misogi
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Before we decide the right course of action, I want you to try something.”
MINA: “Make your way to the Temple by the Waterfall and try to pass through the falling water.”
MINA: “I’m sure that you’ll fail, but do it. Report the outcome back to me.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Oh dear, you’re soaked.”
MINA: “You couldn’t get through? That was expected.”
MINA: “But you’re otherwise unharmed. That’s very promising.”
MINA: “I think I know what to do with you.”
Objectives: Go to the Temple by the Waterfall

Title: Rejecting Fate
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “All Kamigotchi can succeed, from the Commons to the Epics.”
MENU: “When raising a Kami, take advantage of their strengths.”
MENU: “Build on the foundation of their initial stats. Choose skills that boost what your Kami is already best at before shoring up weaknesses.”
MENU: “But if you’re really not connecting with your Kami, you can try again if you want.”
MENU: “If you have $ONYX, you can use the Vending Machine in the scrapyard to Reroll a Kamigotchi.”
MENU: “After you purchase a Reroll Ticket, you can use it to return one Kami to the pool. In exchange, a new Kami will emerge to join you.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “As you can see, if you want to try rerolling for specific Kami, the option is available.”
MENU: “It might be the case that you love robots and want a team of Scrap Kami.”
MENU: “Maybe you’re a dark, edgy person, so you want Kami that are inclined to maximum violence.”
MENU: “It could even be that you’re searching for one of the rumored Legendary Kami.”
MENU: “Good luck!”

Title: Health & Safety
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “When your Kami gets low on Health, return to the room where you left it, then use the Harvesting Menu to pick it up. “
MENU: “A Kami will slowly regenerate Health on its own while being held.”
MENU: “If you can’t wait, give your Kami a snack or use a Spell Card to restore health.”
MENU: “Kamigotchi don’t need food to live, but they can draw energy from food to bolster their spirit.”
MENU: “Use an item to heal a Kami and complete this quest. If you already used the Spell Card that I gave you, go buy some food or dig up a Cheeseburger.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “While Kami don’t see Harvesting as labor, they still get tired and lose Health.”
MENU: “Kamigotchi hold their bodies together with spiritual energy. As they expend energy, it gets harder to maintain their form.”
MENU: “Low Health doesn’t mean a Kami is physically hurt, but it’s still a problem you should take care of.”
Objectives: Use an item to heal a Kamigotchi that has been reduced below 100% Health
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: There Are Levels to This
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Unlike humans, Kamigotchi have the potential to grow and change by using xenoplasticity, or “XP” for short.”
MENU: “This means that they can assimilate many different things to form a new cohesive whole.”
MENU: “Take a look at your roster.
MENU: “If you open up an individual Kami’s profile, you’ll see a progress bar with a percentage indicator beneath the portrait.”
MENU: “When the Kami is ready to move to the next level and the bar fills up, it will read 100%.”
MENU: “Just level up a Kami and you’ll be done.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Here’s a little reward to help with the leveling.”
MENU: “Take note of your new skill point and hold onto it for the next quest.”

Title: Skill Issue
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “When you spend Skill Points to tell Kami what to focus on, you shape their personalities and temperaments.”
MENU: “Think hard before you make a choice!”
MENU: “You’ll only be able to respec with specific items, and they’re difficult to acquire. This is a commitment.”
MENU: “Click on a Kami that has leveled up and gained a skill point recently, then look over the skill tree.”
MENU: “Remember, you can’t go wrong by improving what your Kami is already good at.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: Feel like you made the right choice?
MENU: “It can be difficult to accept, even if you know you made a good decision.”
MENU: “At least, that’s how I think.”
Objectives: Spend a point in any Skill Tree after levelling up

Title: Spring Rites
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I see one of your Kami got Liquidated.”
MENU: “That sucks!”
MENU: “Of course, that’s just a temporary condition.”
MENU: “In this world it’s usually possible to return to form no matter what happens.”
MENU: “The essence of something remains unless it’s been totally erased from existence.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: Take this and use it on a Kami that has been Liquidated.
MENU: “Just read the incantation printed on the front, and presto! This powerful spell card brings your Kami back to action. 
MENU: “It’s the only freebie I’m allowed to give you. You’ll have to work for more spell cards like this one.”
MENU: “Certain shopkeepers might sell different kinds of revival magic, but these cards are premium SSR.”
Requirements: Have one of your own Kami liquidated
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x “Melkarth’s Heroic Awakening” Spell Card

Title: What’s In a Name?
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Southeast through the old forest you can find a small shrine by a mountain waterfall.”
MENU: “With the rare Holy Dust item, you can perform a ritual there to grant your Kami a name.”
MENU: “If you don’t have Holy Dust, a small donation of $ONYX to the shrine will suffice!”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “I think that fits.”
MENU: “It seems happy with the new name!”

Title: Land Survey
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Your march helped find an interesting anomaly, but I’m positive something else is hidden around here.”
MENU: “I’ve checked and re-checked more times than you’d care to hear about.”
MENU: “Move 500 times. We’re bound to find something by the end.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “This map just doesn’t feel right.”
MENU: “I’m only really sure about a third of it.”
MENU: “Something still doesn’t line up! It’s going to take a lot of legwork to figure this one out.”
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

Title: Peregrination
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “They say measure twice, cut once, but that’s still taking an unnecessary risk.”
MENU: “Best to measure a thousand times for the most accurate data. Sometimes the numbers might have changed.”
MENU: “Please move 1000 times. Cover every inch of this world. I’ll scan as you go.”
MENU: “I have a nagging feeling that I’m missing something.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “It seems like what you’re perceiving through my windows is only an abstraction of the actual Kamigotchi World.”
MENU: “So maybe I’m sensing some discrepancy between that and reality?”
MENU: “I guess that’s why I’m looking for things that don’t seem to be there.”
MENU: “I don’t really feel satisfied with this explanation.”
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,3x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

MINA: “It allows a Kami to harvest for longer periods of time by boosting its ability to endure the strain.”

MINA: “Your Kami might beg for another sip, but they’re just fond of the flavor.”

Title: Hex Education III
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “A simple but powerful recipe, this potion is capable of undoing the mistakes you’ve no doubt made when raising your Kami.”
MINA: “The key ingredient is Mint.”
MINA: “While common elsewhere, it grows in only a few places in this world and rarely spreads.”
MINA: “Find one Mint and grind it up, you’ll need every single shred for one potion.”
MINA: “It’s an elusive reagent, so be patient while you’re on the hunt.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Properly taking your Kami’s traits and affinities into account will save you from headaches.”
MINA: ”Train a Kami well and everyone profits.”
MINA: ”Train a Kami poorly, and you’ll lose a great deal of time or money on the hunt for Mint.”
MINA: “The obsessive search for rare ingredients can drive one to madness.”
MINA: “You might handle it better than others.”

Title: Customer Loyalty Program II
Introduction Dialogue:

MINA: “You won’t get better prices anywhere else, you know.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “An oblation from your wallet to my register.” 
MINA: “Thank you.”

Title: Going Out For a Coffee
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I came across this beverage long ago when I met the peoples of Lake Shala.”
MINA: “I was quite taken by its taste, though I can’t recall when I last had it.”
MINA: “We don’t have access to the real ingredients here, but I believe materials are available to make an approximation.”
MINA: “Start by crafting a proper receptacle: Chisel a chunk of Stone with a Screwdriver to make an Empty Cup.”
MINA: “For the approximate materials, seek out a Sanguine Shroom for the color and body, and a Pine Cone for the dry finish and spicy floral aroma.”
MINA: “It may sound unpleasant, but wait until it’s been brewed before you judge.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “You might think it possible to drink this potion from a plastic bottle or a glass jar, but it isn’t.”
MINA: “Only a proper stone cup will do.” 
MINA: “A spiced floral bouquet, and on the palate a touch of acid leading into a bitter finish…”
MINA: “You did well.”
MINA: “I’d nearly forgotten how pleasant an experience it is to share a drink with someone.”
MINA: “We’ll have to do this again sometime.”

Title: Teatime
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I just gave you a lesson to craft a useful potion with Mint, but could you put that aside for a moment?”
MINA: “With the mint on my mind, I’d like a cup of tea.”
MINA: “I deserve a break after all this work, you must agree.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Moments like this are important to me.”
MINA: “Relaxation, conversation, a small distraction from the eternal march of time.”
MINA: “Now back to business.”

Title: The Wages of Sin
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I noticed some strange coins in your inventory.”
MENU: “The design is a little like an ancient Greek obol, but there’s something off about the metal. It’s too pure for the era.”
MENU: “And the way they catch the light and glitter despite being so dull, it’s not right.”
MENU: “Give me a handful. I’ll run a battery of tests.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “Results inconclusive.”
MENU: “The metal is even more pure than I initially thought.”
MENU: “These coins are multiple times older than Greek civilization itself.”
MENU: “It’s like they just got dreamed into existence. I can’t make sense of it.”

Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I know there’s a window on me somewhere, a secret shop where you can use those Obols to buy something.”
MENU: “Don’t tell me it’s not real, I can feel it there.”
MENU: “They refuse to sell to me, so you’re going to have to shell out just this once.”
MENU: “I want you to buy what they’re selling and give it to Mina.”
MENU: “She’ll probably be able to tell us something about it.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “They’re serpent eggs, hollowed out and filled with treasure.”
MENU: “She got really upset when I asked if she had anything to do with it.”
MINA: ”It’s distasteful to the extreme.”
MINA: “The fiends who craft these eggs should hope I never meet them.”

Title: Rearview Mirror
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Wow, this place is very pretty.”
MENU: “It looks like such a fantastical world. Even the bricks are some odd purple stone.”
MENU: “And look at that huge sword!”
MINA: “Nothing I haven’t seen before.”
MINA: “And this is actually a rather small amount of gold.”
MENU: “Well, it’s new to me.”
MENU: “Operator, harvest here for a little bit. I want to feel how different it is for myself.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “It reminds me of playing tabletop rpgs as a kid.”
MINA: “What’s that?”
MENU: “R-P-G. It stands for role-playing game. You pretend to be someone else and roll dice and stuff, collecting coins and leveling up.”
MENU: “It’s kind of fun.”
MINA: “Putting on other faces, tempting fate, amassing money and power?”
MINA: “It sounds too much like real life.”
Objectives: Harvest for >360 minutes at Treasure Hoard

Introduction Dialogue:

MENU: “It’s not going to be some kind of curse, right? You’d tell me, right Mina?”
MINA: “It doesn’t look cursed.”
MINA: “But I might as well take a closer look.”
MINA: “If you get a bag together, show them to me. I can almost always tell you where a coin is from.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “I used to know this ogress, believe it or not.”
MENU: “Ogress? Looks more like an elf to me.”
MINA: “She looks better on coinage. The profile hides her bad side.”
MINA: “These have been worthless for quite some time. The value crashed after the queen passed away.”
MINA: “Speculating on this coin lost me a chunk of wealth, but still, I’m glad that hag is dead.”
MENU: “They might be useless, but I think it’s fine if the Operator collects them.”
MENU: “I sort of like having them around. They’re neat. Maybe we’ll find a buyer later!”
MINA: “Ridiculous. They might as well be scrap metal.”
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x “Melkarth’s Heroic Awakening” Spell Card

Title: Happy Hunting Ground
Introduction Dialogue:

MINA: “We’re far, far from the Kamigotchi World, warped through the reflection off of a mirrored blade.”
MINA: “The trophies on display commemorate the slaying of monsters you may have never seen before.”
MINA: “But don’t get fired up to explore.”
MINA: “We’re locked in a treasure room with sealed exits.”
MENU: “The world beyond might be sealed off, but we can take treasure back with us, right?”
MINA: “Oh, of course.”
MINA: “Scavenge some things while you’re here. You might find something interesting.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MENU: “The stuff here is so cool, but I’m starting to not like the vibes here.”
MENU: “It feels like we’re being watched.”
MINA: “We might be.”
MINA: “It’s nothing to get worked up over.”
MINA: “I would have felt a presence if there were anyone here of any importance.”
MINA: “If someone really is watching, it’s likely a worthless creature of no concern.”

Title: Better to Light a Candle
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “The magic here must seem quite old fashioned to you, Menu.”
MINA: “You say this resembles the medieval fantasy fiction of your day?”
MENU: “Yeah, the castles, the treasure, the monsters. It’s nostalgic.”
MINA: “In the long run, this is really all rather recent.”
MINA: “Significantly moreso than the culture hidden in the caves of the Kamigotchi World, believe it or not.”
MINA: “The magic of Annfwn was quite elegant.”
MINA: “To cast a curse upon another, one only needed some words carved on a tablet.”
MINA: “You can find a few curse tablets tossed in the corners here. Pick one up for me.”
Resolution Dialogue:
MINA: “Incantation-based hexing is a classic style, really.”
MINA: “It wasn’t invented here, but you rarely see it expressed in such a straightforward form.”
MINA: “It’s trendy to bolster your incantations with gestures, by preparing a ceremonial space, that sort of thing.”
MINA: “In my opinion, that’s all just showmanship.”
MINA: “The curse is what matters, and this is a pure expression.”
MENU: “Maybe one day you can teach us how to make them.”
MENU: “We just need a screwdriver as a chisel, right?”
MINA: “I’ll think about it.”

Title: Sweet Deal
Introduction Dialogue:
ROB: “I’m starvin’ over here. You know that?”
ROB: “Got a nice view and all, but they stopped with the lunches a long time back.”
ROB: “Even when we got food, it was just a little barley and milk.”
ROB: “Nothin’ for the sweet tooth at all. That’d be spoiling me.”
ROB: “You got anything sweet to share? Give it here.”
ROB: “I’ll make it a worthwhile exchange.”
Resolution Dialogue:
ROB: “How do I get these cards to give you? Well, that’s how it works, ain’t it? You do something nice for me, I give you a reward.”
ROB: “What brought you here, anyway? Ya don’t look familiar.”
ROB: “Must have been a long trip.”
ROB: “I’m a traveler at heart too, y’see. But this treasure chamber? It’s stuffy. Boxed up tight.”
ROB: “You seemed to get in just fine, though. I might’ve even seen ya leave again.”
ROB: “How’s about I follow you out?”
ROB: “Heh heh. Just kidding. I’m fettered tight to this stone for now.”
ROB: “Still hungry, too. Got any meat?”
